intro: Polyosma urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet holly, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are dark green and glossy, while its white or pink flowers bloom in the spring, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
